summary: The Kangaroo Protection Act of 2025 prohibits activities involving kangaroos and kangaroo products. It defines kangaroos based on species and defines kangaroo products. The bill makes it unlawful to bring kangaroos into the U.S. for commercial purposes, possess them with intent to sell, or sell them. It also prohibits the sale, trade, or distribution in interstate commerce of kangaroo products. Violators face fines and imprisonment. The Secretary of Commerce will issue regulations. The act takes effect 180 days after enactment.
